results.title: Summerfield
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Patricia Lovell and Clare Beach Films
results.brief_description: When a newcomer arrives in a small, secluded town to discover that the former teacher has disappeared, he probes into the mystery and becomes more and more intrigued by the inhabitants of a forbidding house called Summerfield. Eventually, the secrets of Summerfield are revealed in a dramatic ending with a shock twist. Directed by Ken Hannam (director of ‘Sunday Too Far Away’) and starring, Nick Tate, Elizabeth Alexander and John Waters, ‘Summerfield’ was shot on location at Victoria’s Phillip and Churchill Islands.

results.title: Summer City
results.creator_credit: Christopher Fraser, Phil Avalon and Summer City Productions
results.brief_description: Set in the early 1960’s, four young men take off for a weekend fling in search of girls, surf, and thrills, but encounter fear and death. Stars Mel Gibson, Steve Bisley, John Jarratt and Abigail.

results.title: Stone
results.brief_description: Several members of a bikie gang are mysteriously murdered. An undercover cop becomes the man in the middle trying to both protect the bikies and prevent them from taking venegeance. The film is perhaps more convincing as an exploration of a lifestyle than as a thriller with a series of conventionally conceived and effectively staged stunts and chases backed by a heavy rock score. With a box-office return of around ten times the $195,000 budget, ‘Stone’ ranks with films like ‘Alvin Purple’ as the most successful pre-Croc Australian feature. Cast includes Ken Shorter, Sandy Harbutt, Helen Morse, Vincent Gil, Hugh Keays-Byrne, Rebecca Gilling, Roger Ward, Bill Hunter and Gary McDonald.

results.title: Doctors and nurses
results.creator_credit: Maurice Murphy, Brian Rosen, Finn Productions and Universal Entertainment
results.brief_description: Comedy in which roles are reversed in a children’s hospital so that the children are in control and diagnosing the problems of “childish” adults.

results.title: Iceman
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Norman Jewison, Patrick Palmer and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Drama about a team of Arctic researchers who find a 40,000 year old man frozen in ice and bring him back to life. The anthropologist wants to befriend him and learn about man’s past while the medical researchers want to discover the secret that will allow man to live in a frozen state. Stars Timothy Hutton, John Lone and Lindsay Crouse.

results.title: Warm nights on a slow moving train
results.creator_credit: Bob Ellis, Patric Juillet, Ross Dimsey and Western Pacific Films
results.brief_description: Wendy Hughes plays an art teacher employed at a Catholic girls’ convent school from Monday to Friday. At weekends she rides the overnight express train between Sydney and Melbourne as a prostitute in order to keep her addict brother supplied with morphine. Every week she changes her appearance, mannerisms, and personality, luring male clients who always pay and leave by 3 a.m. However, an intelligence agent (Colin Friels) becomes her lover and they team up to murder a politician on the train. Wendy Hughes exudes sensuality, power and passion in the lead role.

results.title: Plenty
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Edward Pressman, RKO Radio Pictures and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the play of the same name by David Hare. A young Englishwoman returns from fighting with the resistance in World War 2 and finds the apathy of post-war England difficult to tolerate. As her idealistic dreams give way to the realities of experience so her sanity gives way to madness. Stars Meryl Streep, Charles Dance, Tracey Ullman, John Gielgud, Sting and Sam Neill.

results.title: Turkey shoot
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Antony Ginnane, William Fayman and Filmco
results.brief_description: Set in 1995 where criminals are hunted in controlled environments. There is no room for individuality and anyone who dares to be different is thrown into a detention camp for brainwashing where they are tortured and become candidates for manhunts. Cast includes Steve Railsback, Olivia Hussey, Michael Craig and Carmen Duncan.

results.title: Touch and go
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, John Pellatt and Maxwell-Pellatt
results.brief_description: Comedy about six women who take to a life of crime in order to aid their favourite charitable causes. Stars Wendy Hughes, Chantal Cantouri, Carmen Duncan and Jon English and features a script by Peter Yeldham.

results.title: Crimes of the Heart
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Freddie Fields, De Laurentiis Entertainment Group and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Unconventional comedy in which three writers reunite and share their problems, eccentricities and idiosyncrasies during a reunion. The youngest has just been released from prison after shooting her husband because he beat up her black lover. During their time together assorted family secrets are revealed. Based on play of the same name by Beth Henley, which won a Pulitzer Prize. Stars Diane Keaton, Jessica Lange and Sissy Spacek.
